info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 3:17PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...An area of heavy rain will impact portions of north central Whiteside, Carroll and northeastern Clinton Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain near Argo Fay, or near Mount Carroll, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding of water and minor flooding on roadways and in low lying locations. Locations impacted include... Mount Carroll, Savanna, Lanark, Milledgeville, Fairhaven, Sabula, Chadwick, Argo Fay, Thomson, Wacker, Ideal, Center Hill and Thomson Causeway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement
